awd_abstract_narration: The project concerns evaluation of a new machining technique                which combines elements of wire Electro Discharge Machining (EDM)               and Electro Chemical Machining (ECM). The metal removal process                 involves the anodic dissolution of the workpiece in close proximity             to a moving wire. A prototype single-axis wire ECM machine will be              built to prove the concept, in addition to detailed theoretical                 analysis.                                                                            Such a machine, if it is successfully built and tested, would              have the advantages of wire EDM without its adverse heat treatment              effects on the machined surface. Also, in such a machine, high                  fluid pressures would not be needed, reducing machine and tooling               stresses and avoiding one of the main disadvantages of conventional             ECM.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
